docs.abstract: The idea of eternal damnation is neither biblically, philosophically nor morally justified. But for many it retains a psychological allure.
docs.snippet: The idea of eternal damnation is neither biblically, philosophically nor morally justified. But for many it retains a psychological allure.
docs.lead_paragraph: Once the faith of his youth had faded into the serene agnosticism of his mature years, Charles Darwin found himself amazed that anyone could even wish Christianity to be true. Not, that is, the kindlier bits — “Love thy neighbor” and whatnot — but rather the notion that unbelievers (including relatives and friends) might be tormented in hell forever.

headline.main: Why Do People Believe in Hell?
headline.print_headline: Why Do People Believe In Hell?

docs.abstract: Ivanka Trump’s husband will now supervise her father’s re-election campaign, but he continues to weigh in with advice to the president on a range of other matters.
docs.snippet: Ivanka Trump’s husband will now supervise her father’s re-election campaign, but he continues to weigh in with advice to the president on a range of other matters.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When senior administration officials gathered in the Situation Room on Tuesday for a meeting to discuss the repercussions of the killing of Maj. Gen. Qassim Suleimani, Vice President Mike Pence had a seat at the table. So did Robert O’Brien, the national security adviser, and Mark T. Esper, the defense secretary.

headline.main: Kushner’s Global Role Shrinks as He Tackles Another: The 2020 Election
headline.print_headline: Kushner Changes Focus  To Overseeing Campaign

byline.original: By Annie Karni and Maggie Haberman

docs.abstract: Al Pacino’s portrayal of the union leader in “The Irishman” differs markedly from Jack Nicholson’s take in a 1992 movie.
docs.snippet: Al Pacino’s portrayal of the union leader in “The Irishman” differs markedly from Jack Nicholson’s take in a 1992 movie.
docs.lead_paragraph: It’s not hard to see what drew two of the finest actors of their generation to play James R. Hoffa. Sure, the man spent decades in the public eye, led what was then the nation’s largest labor union, sparred with the Kennedys and disappeared in one of the quintessential unsolved mysteries in recent history. But he’s also a great character, a sizzle reel of big, boisterous speeches, roaring dressing-downs and showy theatricality. It’s the kind of role an actor can really sink his teeth into, especially if he’s known for chewing a bit of scenery — a delicacy frequently enjoyed by both Jack Nicholson, who played the title role in the 1992 “Hoffa,” and Al Pacino, currently garnering awards buzz for his work as Hoffa in “The Irishman.”

headline.main: Hoffa vs. Hoffa: How Two Actors Found Their Character
headline.print_headline: Hoffa Was Big Enough for Both of Them

docs.abstract: The president put us on a path toward conflict and turmoil with Iran.
docs.snippet: The president put us on a path toward conflict and turmoil with Iran.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump says that on his watch, Iran will never be allowed to have a nuclear weapon. But if he had wanted to keep that promise, he should have left the 2015 Iran nuclear agreement in place. Instead, he pulled the United States out of the deal and pursued a reckless foreign policy that has put us on a path to armed conflict with Iran.

headline.main: John Kerry: Diplomacy Was Working Until Trump Abandoned It

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.abstract: The decline of discourse in the anti-Trump echo chamber.
docs.snippet: The decline of discourse in the anti-Trump echo chamber.
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump is impulse-driven, ignorant, narcissistic and intellectually dishonest. So you’d think that those of us in the anti-Trump camp would go out of our way to show we’re not like him — that we are judicious, informed, mature and reasonable.

headline.main: Trump Has Made Us All Stupid
headline.print_headline: Trump Has Made Us  All Stupid

docs.abstract: The company expressed regret at the embarrassing communications it sent to investigators on Thursday, which included a comment that “this airplane is designed by clowns, who are in turn supervised by monkeys.”
docs.snippet: The company expressed regret at the embarrassing communications it sent to investigators on Thursday, which included a comment that “this airplane is designed by clowns, who are in turn supervised by monkeys.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Boeing employees mocked federal rules, talked about deceiving regulators and joked about potential flaws in the 737 Max as it was being developed, according to over a hundred pages of internal messages delivered Thursday to congressional investigators.

headline.main: Boeing Employees Mocked F.A.A. and ‘Clowns’ Who Designed 737 Max

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Boeing 737 Max Groundings and Safety Concerns (2019)

docs.abstract: The star tenor, now 56, returns to the boyish role of his breathlessly hyped 1996 debut.
docs.snippet: The star tenor, now 56, returns to the boyish role of his breathlessly hyped 1996 debut.
docs.lead_paragraph: A skeletal set had been constructed deep within the Metropolitan Opera earlier this week for a rehearsal of Puccini’s “La Bohème,” and the antics of the opening act ensued in a rough approximation of a garret apartment in 19th-century Paris.

headline.main: 24 Years Later, Roberto Alagna Steps Back Into ‘Bohème’ at the Met
headline.print_headline: Stepping Back  Into ‘Bohème’ At the Met

docs.abstract: Submitting to Washington’s pressure is no minor affair in Latin America. But President Alberto Fernández would do well to put Evo Morales and Nicolás Maduro behind him.
docs.snippet: Submitting to Washington’s pressure is no minor affair in Latin America. But President Alberto Fernández would do well to put Evo Morales and Nicolás Maduro behind him.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — Aside from Nicaragua, Cuba and Venezuela, countries mired in dictatorships and crises, the only democratic, center-left governments in Latin America today are those of Mexico and Argentina. Both have to deal with bullying from a distracted and erratic administration in Washington. Argentina’s incoming president, Alberto Fernández, as the new kid on the block, has the tougher challenge today.

headline.main: Argentina Needs Help. Trump Is the Answer.

docs.abstract: Doctors reset Helen Obando’s DNA in an effort to cure her of a painful genetic blood disorder. She’s the youngest person to receive the treatment.
docs.snippet: Doctors reset Helen Obando’s DNA in an effort to cure her of a painful genetic blood disorder. She’s the youngest person to receive the treatment.
docs.lead_paragraph: Meet Helen Obando, a shy 16-year-old who likes to dance when her body isn’t ravaged by the debilitating symptoms of sickle cell disease. The genetic blood disorder can cause strokes, organ damage and intense pain that can feel like glass running through her veins.

headline.main: A Teenager’s Breakthrough Gene Therapy for Sickle Cell Disease

docs.abstract: The curator of the High Line will be the first Italian woman to organize the show.
docs.snippet: The curator of the High Line will be the first Italian woman to organize the show.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Venice Biennale, the world’s longest-running large-scale survey of contemporary art, looked locally and internationally to find a curator for its next edition — and selected a leader who personifies both. She is Cecilia Alemani, the curator of New York’s High Line, the organization announced Friday.

headline.main: Cecilia Alemani Named Curator of Next Venice Biennale
headline.print_headline: The Venice Biennale Picks Its Next Curator
